remarks:
The rule of modus tollens.  The rule says, "if ` ps ` is not true, and ` ph ` implies ` ps ` , then ` ph ` must also be not true."  Modus tollens is short for "modus tollendo tollens," a Latin phrase that means "the mode that by denying denies" - remark in [Sanford] p. 39.  It is also called denying the consequent.  Modus tollens is closely related to modus ponens ~ ax-mp .  Note that this rule is also valid in intuitionistic logic.  Inference associated with ~ con3i .  (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Sep-2013.)
